subject: Programming
title: Greedy Algorithms
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Greedy Algorithms.

hook.text: A greedy algorithm always picks the best option right now without looking ahead.

buildup.text: Making change is greedy: pick the largest coin that fits, repeat until done.

discovery.text: Greedy works perfectly when local choices lead to a global optimum. For coins, it usually does.

twist.text: But with some coin sets, greedy fails. Local best doesn't always mean global best.

climax.text: Dijkstra's algorithm is greedy and works. The traveling salesman's greedy approach fails badly.

punchline.text: Greedy is fast but only right sometimes.

quiz.question: When do greedy algorithms work well?
options: When local choices lead to a global optimum
When the problem is very large
